JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the city of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant issued her husband , PERSON with a power of attorney ( registered by a notary public under no . DATE ) which provided as follows :

“ I , PERSON , ... hereby authorise Mr PERSON , ... to act on my behalf ... in civil and criminal proceedings before all judicial bodies , with all the rights which the law confers on a plaintiff , defendant , third party or victim , including the rights to enter into a friendly settlement , to accept or to withdraw the claim in full or in part , to change the grounds of the claim , to lodge appeal against a judgment , to receive a writ of execution with the right to receive property and money , to sign documents on my behalf and to perform any other actions related to the fulfilment of this authority . ”
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant left PERSON , where both she and PERSON had lived , and moved to GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON lodged an action on the applicant ’s behalf against a private company . He claimed that the company had overcharged the applicant ’s telephone communications and sought compensation of pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage . He enclosed the power of attorney mentioned above .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG disallowed the action with reference to LAW and stating as follows :

“ PERSON statement of claim is signed by her proxy , PERSON . However , the right to lodge an action with a court ( the right to sign the statement of claim ) is not listed in the submitted copy of the power of attorney ; this suggests that PERSON does not have the right to lodge a claim on behalf of Ms GPE . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision . It found that the applicant had not authorised PERSON to sign a statement of claim and to lodge it on her behalf .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON lodged on behalf of the applicant an action seeking to void a contract for the sale of shares between her and a private company . He enclosed a copy of the power of attorney no . DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to entertain the action . It reasoned as follows :

“ On DATE the ORG received the statement of claim on behalf of PERSON ... The statement was lodged with the court and signed by PERSON on behalf of the plaintiff . However , the power of attorney no . CARDINAL of DATE produced to the court does not entitle PERSON to lodge an action on behalf of PERSON .
Thus , the judge disallows the action under LAW of LAW , as the statement of claim on behalf of the person concerned was lodged by a person who did not have the right [ to do so ] . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision and found as follows :
“ Under LAW a judge disallows an action if the action was lodged on behalf of the person concerned by a person who did not have the right to pursue the case .

As the power of attorney issued by PERSON to PERSON did not list the right of the representative to lodge statements of claim on behalf of the represented person , the judge lawfully disallowed the action . ”
CARDINAL . DATE ( “ the DATE Code ” , as in force at the material time ) provided :
“ ORG may pursue their cases in court in person or through representatives ... ”
“ The powers of the representative should be set down in the power of attorney issued and formalised in accordance with the law ... ”

“ The authority to pursue a case in court entitles the representative to perform on behalf of the client all procedural acts , with the exception of seeking the transfer of the case to a LAW or an arbitration court ; withdrawing claims in full or in part ; admitting a claim ; varying the grounds of a claim ; entering into a friendly settlement ; transferring the power of attorney ; lodging an appeal against a judgment ; submitting the enforcement writ for execution ; obtaining the awarded property or money . The representative ’s authority to perform any of the acts listed in this LAW should be explicitly stated in the power of attorney issued by the client . ”
“ The judge decides ... whether to accept for examination the statement of claim in a civil case .
The judge refuses to accept a statement of claim for examination ...
CARDINAL ) if it was submitted on behalf of the interested party by a person not empowered to pursue the case ...

The judge ’s refusal to accept the statement of claim for examination on the grounds provided by paragraphs ... and CARDINAL ... does not prevent [ the party ] from reapplying to the court on the same ground , provided that the indicated shortcoming is rectified ... ”
CARDINAL . DATE Code of Civil Procedure ( “ the DATE Code ” ) which replaced LAW from DATE provides :

“ The representative has the authority to perform on behalf of his client all procedural actions . However , the representative ’s authority to sign the statement of claim ; to lodge it with a court ; to seek transfer of the dispute to a court of arbitration ; to lodge a counter - claim ; to withdraw the claims in full or in part ... to enter in a friendly settlement ... should be specifically listed in the power of attorney issued by the client . ”
